sub_topic: Preparation of benzocaine from p-aminobenzoic acid and ethanol
message_1: What is the maximum yield of benzocaine that can be obtained from 10 grams of p-aminobenzoic acid and 20 grams of ethanol? Show all the necessary steps and calculations to support your answer.
message_2:
To determine the maximum yield of benzocaine, we need to first find the limiting reagent in the reaction between p-aminobenzoic acid and ethanol. We will use the stoichiometry of the reaction and the molecular weights of the compounds involved to calculate the theoretical yield of benzocaine.

The balanced chemical equation for the synthesis of benzocaine (C9H11NO2) from p-aminobenzoic acid (C7H7NO2) and ethanol (C2H5OH) is as follows:

C7H7NO2 + C2H5OH → C9H11NO2 + H2O

From the balanced equation, we can see that the mole ratio of p-aminobenzoic acid to ethanol to benzocaine is 1:1:1.

First, we need to find the molecular weights of the compounds involved:

Molecular weight of p-aminobenzoic acid (C7H7NO2) = (7 × 12.01) + (7 × 1.01) + (1 × 14.01) + (2 × 16.00) = 137.14 g/mol
Molecular weight of ethanol (C2H5OH) = (2 × 12.01) + (6 × 1.01) + (1 × 16.00) = 46.07 g/mol
Molecular weight of benzocaine (C9H11NO2) = (9 × 12.01) + (11 × 1.01) + (1 × 14.01) + (2 × 16.00) = 165.19 g/mol

Next, we will calculate the moles of p-aminobenzoic acid and ethanol:

Moles of p-aminobenzoic acid = 10 g / 137.14 g/mol = 0.0729 mol
Moles of ethanol = 20 g / 46.07 g/mol = 0.434 mol

Now, we will determine the limiting reagent by comparing the mole ratio of p-aminobenzoic acid to ethanol:

Mole ratio = moles of p-aminobenzoic acid / moles of ethanol = 0.0729 mol / 0.434 mol = 0.168

Since the mole ratio is less than 1, p-aminobenzoic acid is the limiting reagent. Therefore, the maximum yield of benzocaine will be determined by the amount of p-aminobenzoic acid available.

Finally, we will calculate the theoretical yield of benzocaine:

Theoretical yield of benzocaine = moles of p-aminobenzoic acid × molecular weight of benzocaine = 0.0729 mol × 165.19 g/mol = 12.03 g

Thus, the maximum yield of benzocaine that can be obtained from 10 grams of p-aminobenzoic acid and 20 grams of ethanol is 12.03 grams.
